```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)

library(data.table)

library(ggplot2)
raw_data_fig1<-read_excel(here::here("Input/Data/Murray_2006_Estimates.xlsx"))
raw_data_fig2<-read_dta(here::here("Input/Data/LOC_Newspapers_Sep18_Dec19.dta"))

raw_data_fig4_1<-read.table(here::here("output/data/cleaned_figure4_data/m110112.txt"))
```

```{r}
###########Figure 1 ##########
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Median Excess Mortality Rate by Age and Sex in 13 Countries""
#| label: figure1_mortality

### Data clean ###
process_data_fig1 <- raw_data_fig1 %>% 
  pivot_longer(
  cols = c("female", "male"), 
  names_to = "gender", 
  values_to = "mortality_rate"
  )
cleaned_figure1_data <- process_data_fig1[, c(1, 3, 2)]

# Make sure the order of the age group is the order we wanted
age_cat_order <- c("0 to 4", "5 to 9", "10 to 14", "15 to 19", "20 to 24", "25 to 29",
                   "30 to 34", "35 to 39", "40 to 44", "45 to 49", "50 to 54", "55 to 59"
                   , "60 to 64", "65 to 69", "70 to 74")
cleaned_figure1_data$age_cat <- 
  factor(cleaned_figure1_data$age_cat, 
         levels = age_cat_order)

# Store cleaned data
write.csv(cleaned_figure1_data, file = here::here("Output/Data/cleaned_figure1_data.csv"), row.names = FALSE)


### Draw graph ###
ggplot(cleaned_figure1_data, aes(
  x = age_cat,
  y = mortality_rate,
  group = gender, 
  color = gender)) +
  geom_line()+
  scale_x_discrete(limits = age_cat_order)+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 70, hjust = 1))+
  labs(y = "Excess Mortality Rate During Pandemic \n(Deaths per 100 persons)", 
       x = "Age Group")
```

```{r}
###########Figure 2 ##########
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Regional Patterns of Influenza Newspaper Coverage"
#| label: figure2

### Clean data ###
cleaned_figure2_data <-
  raw_data_fig2 |>
  # Select only certain columns
  select(
   flu_sep1_1918_dec31_1919,
   year,
   month,
   region
  )

# Rename column
cleaned_figure2_data <-
 cleaned_figure2_data |>
  rename(
    influence = flu_sep1_1918_dec31_1919
  )

# Group by year, month, and region
cleaned_figure2_data<- cleaned_figure2_data %>%
  group_by(year, month, region) %>%
  summarize(total_influence = sum(influence)) %>%
  ungroup()

# Create a new column to store date in month.year format
cleaned_figure2_data$date_label <- format(as.Date(paste(cleaned_figure2_data$year, cleaned_figure2_data$month, "01", sep = "-")), "%b.%Y")
cleaned_figure2_data$date_label <- factor(cleaned_figure2_data$date_label, levels = unique(cleaned_figure2_data$date_label))

# Change the region name
cleaned_figure2_data <- cleaned_figure2_data %>%
  mutate(region = case_when(
    region == 1 ~ "Northeast",
    region == 2 ~ "Midwest",
    region == 3 ~ "South",
    region == 4 ~ "West"
  ))

# Store cleaned data for figure 2
write.csv(cleaned_figure2_data, file = here::here("Output/Data/cleaned_figure2_data.csv"), row.names = FALSE)

### Draw graph ###
ggplot(cleaned_figure2_data, aes(x = date_label, y = total_influence, group = region, color = region)) +
  geom_line() +
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("Sep.\n2018","", "Nov.\n1918","", "Jan.\n1919","","Mar.\n 1919","", "May.\n 1919","","Jul.\n1919","","Sep.\n1919","","Nov.\n1919","")) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(0, 1200, 2400, 3600, 4800, 6000))+
  labs(x = "Publication Month", y = "Articles mentioning influenza")
  
```

```{r}
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Period Life Expectancy by Year in 14 Countries"
#| label: figure3
### Clean data ###
# Select only certain columns
cleaned_figure3_data <-
  raw_data_fig3 |>
  select(
   entity,
   year,
   lifeexpectancyyears
  )
cleaned_figure3_data <- cleaned_figure3_data %>%
  filter(year >= 1900, year <= 1940)

#calculate the mean of life expectanacy years
calculate_mean<- cleaned_figure3_data %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarize(average_life_expectancy = mean(lifeexpectancyyears)) %>%
  ungroup()

#add lines
add_number <- calculate_mean %>% 
  select(year) %>% 
  n_distinct()
added_data <- data.frame(
  year = rep(1900:1940, each = 1),
  entity = rep("average", add_number),
  lifeexpectancyyears = numeric(add_number)
)

#combine table together
final_figure3_data <- rbind(cleaned_figure3_data, added_data)

#replaced the average life expectancy years
final_figure3_data$lifeexpectancyyears[
  final_figure3_data$entity == "average"] <- 
  calculate_mean$average_life_expectancy[
      calculate_mean$year == final_figure3_data$year[
        final_figure3_data$entity == "average"]]

#store cleaned data for figure 3
write.csv(final_figure3_data, file = here::here("Output/Data/cleaned_figure3_data.csv"), row.names = FALSE)

###Draw graph###
new_dataset <- 
  final_figure3_data %>% 
  filter(entity %in% c("Italy","Denmark","average"))

ggplot(final_figure3_data, aes(
  x = year, 
  y = lifeexpectancyyears, 
  color = entity
  )) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.2) +
  geom_line(data = new_dataset, aes(
  x = year, 
  y = lifeexpectancyyears, 
  color = entity
  )) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "Period Life Expectancy Years"
  )
  
```

```{r}
#########Figure 4###########
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Stock Market Indices"
#| label: figure4
# add one column to shows the stock market
raw_data_fig4_1$stock_market <- "London Stock Exchange"
raw_data_fig4_2$stock_market <- "U.S., Dow−Jones"

# combine two txt files together
figure4_data <- rbind(raw_data_fig4_1, raw_data_fig4_2)

# rename the column
colnames(figure4_data) <- c("year", "month", "price","stock_market")

# rewrite the data
figure4_data$month_year <- paste(month.abb[figure4_data$month], figure4_data$year, sep=".")

# select what we want
cleaned_figure4_data <- figure4_data %>%
  filter(between(month_year, "Jan.1915", "Jan.1924")) %>%
  select(
    price,
    stock_market,
    month_year
  )

# calculate adjusted index
index1 <- cleaned_figure4_data[
  cleaned_figure4_data$stock_market == "London Stock Exchange" & cleaned_figure4_data$month_year == "Jan.1915", 
  "price"
]
index2 <- cleaned_figure4_data[
  cleaned_figure4_data$stock_market == "U.S., Dow−Jones" & cleaned_figure4_data$month_year == "Jan.1915", 
  "price"
]
index1 <- as.numeric(index1)
index2 <- as.numeric(index2)
index_london <- 100/index1
index_us <- 100/index2
index_london
index_us

# convert the column to numeric
cleaned_figure4_data$price <- as.numeric(cleaned_figure4_data$price)

# adjusted price
cleaned_figure4_data$adjusted_price <- ifelse(
  cleaned_figure4_data$stock_market == "London Stock Exchange",
  cleaned_figure4_data$price * index_london,
  ifelse(cleaned_figure4_data$stock_market == "U.S., Dow−Jones",
         cleaned_figure4_data$price * index_us,
         cleaned_figure4_data$price))

#store cleaned data for figure 4
write.csv(cleaned_figure4_data, file = here::here("Output/Data/cleaned_figure4_data.csv"), row.names = FALSE)

### Draw graph ###
ggplot(cleaned_figure4_data, aes(x = month_year, y = adjusted_price, group = stock_market, color = stock_market)) +
  geom_line() +  
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("Jan.\n1915", "Jan.\n1916", "Jan.\n1917", "Jan.\n1918", "Jan.\n1919", "Jan.\n1920","Jan.\n1921","Jan.\n1922","Jan.\n1923","Jan.\n1924"))
  labs(x = "Month", y = "Price(Jan.1915=100)")
```
